annot.p: (measure 3) and have G♯, while and have G♮ (with no accidental).
(measure 8) and have A♮ (with no accidental in ), while has A♯ (with no accidental).
and have B, while has G, which is surely an error. The passage is different in , but the theme occurs with B in measure 16.
In (measures 19-21) and, both the ties in measure 9 continue to the first beat of measure 11, while in , only the lower C♯ is tied between measures 10 and 11.
(measure 23) and have B♮, while has B♯ (with no accidental).
(measure 25) and have D♯, while has D♮ (with no accidental).
In and , the accidental is missing on the G♯ in the upper staff. (measure 25) is unclear.
has D♮, while has D♯ (with no accidental), which is surely an error. (measure 25) is unclear.
Twice in this beat, (measure 26, though slightly different) and have E♮, while has E♯ (with no accidental).
and have E♮ (with no accidental), while has E♯. The corresponding passage in (starting in measure 29) has neither, and has a somewhat different harmonic structure.

The reading with E♯ maintains the parallelism of the passage: each chromatically descending diminished chord can be seen as a dominant minor ninth whose root appears in the left hand, and the same four-note interval sequence occurs each time. The E♮ reading does not fit this pattern.
(measure 30) and have E♮, while has E♯ (with no accidental).
(measure 30) and have G♮, while has G♯ (with no accidental).
In and , the accidental is missing on the G♯ in the upper staff. has a different structure here.
The chord is staccato in , but not in . (measure 40) has a different structure here.
